title: North Gaza hospital under ‘unprecedented’ attack, health officials say
description: The director of Kamal Adwan Hospital, one of the few functional medical centers in Gaza, said it was targeted by IDF shelling, sniper fire and drones.
author: Niha Masih, Leo Sands, Miriam Berger, Alon Rom, Sammy Westfall
byline: Niha Masih, Leo Sands, Miriam Berger, Alon Rom, Sammy Westfall, Ben Brasch, Dan Lamothe, Kareem Fahim, Loveday Morris, Louisa Loveluck, Greg Miller, Mohamad El Chamaa, Beril Eski, Heidi Levine, Sufian Taha
excerpt: The director of Kamal Adwan Hospital, one of the few functional medical centers in Gaza, said it was targeted by IDF shelling, sniper fire and drones.
text: Health officials in the Gaza Strip said Israeli forces bombarded Kamal Adwan Hospital in Beit Lahia, one of the last functioning hospitals in the enclave’s north, describing the attack as “unprecedented.”Hospital Director Hussam Abu Safiya said in a video message Saturday night that the facility was being hit by shelling, sniper fire and drones, while Gaza’s Health Ministry said on Telegram that the facility was under fire from tanks and explosives.
html:
Health officials in the Gaza Strip said Israeli forces bombarded Kamal Adwan Hospital in Beit Lahia, one of the last functioning hospitals in the enclave’s north, describing the attack as “unprecedented.”

Hospital Director Hussam Abu Safiya said in a video message Saturday night that the facility was being hit by shelling, sniper fire and drones, while Gaza’s Health Ministry said on Telegram that the facility was under fire from tanks and explosives.
